newsitem.title: USA: IBCA South Africa affirms Eskom.
newsitem.headline: IBCA South Africa affirms Eskom.

text.p: NEW YORK, July 23 - IBCA South Africa, a subsidiary of the European credit rating agency IBCA has affirmed its BBB long-term international local currency rating of Eskom.
The rating is the same as the sovereign local currency rating of the Republic of South Africa.
Eskom is invloved in the generation, transmission and distribution of electricity.
It provides some 98 percent of the power consumed in South Africa and is the dominant producer in Africa, supplying more than half the electricity generated on the continent.
Eskom is among the top five utilities in the world in terms of size and sales and is one of the lowest-cost producers globally.
Eskom's high gearing and relatively low coverage are offset by its monopolistic position, strong earnings and cash flow generation and improving operating efficiency.

The majority of its foreign currency denominated borrowings are guaranteed by the State and, while local currency borrowings carry no guarantee, the importance which the utility has within the economy is likely to generate support, should it ever be required from the State.
